results.title: Buzz Lightyear of star command: the adventure begins
results.brief_description: Wonderfully humorous animated children’s film, based around the character Buzz Lightyear from Pixar’s enormously successful “Toy story”. Buzz (a vainglorious and brave space hero) and his partner Agent Z are sent to rescue a swarm of Little Green Men, kidnapped by the evil Zurg, who is trying to discover the secret of their united minds. When Z is lost in battle a disheartened Buzz becomes determined to work alone. When he is ordered to team with Mira Nova, a crack rookie Space Ranger who is also a princess, Buzz faces some serious competition. “Buzz Lightyear” uses traditional cell animation, instead of the digital animation utilised to such great effect in “Toy story”, but the humour of this film easily matches the amusing parodying tone of Pixar’s other feature films, which should prove a delight for children. Features the voices of Tim Allen, Wayne Knight, Nicole Sullivan, Stephen Furst, Larry Miller, Adam Carolla, Diedrich Bader and Patrick Warburton.

results.title: Buzkashi: the national game (D)
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SOME VISUALLY DISTURBING IMAGES Buzkashi is the once forbidden sport performed on horseback by the tribes of Afghanistan. Buzkashi requires incredible riding ability, as the opposing teams battle for a head-less calf. the intense pride and rivalry of a tribal society, as well as the role of physical superiority and competition are implicit. No commentary - natural sound track only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker

results.title: Buying and caring for your puppy
results.creator_credit: Hero Productions, Visual Entertainment Group, Harry Cooper and Kevin Manning
results.brief_description: Buying a puppy takes a lot of time and consideration. Dr Harry Cooper tries to assist this process by providing the viewer with a broad overview of over twenty breeds and cross breeds, and examining the merits of how to select the right breed of dog to suit you. Factors taken into consideration include health, lifestyle and budget. Once a breed has been selected, Dr Harry goes through ensuring you choose a healthy pup, settling the pup in, training, socialisation, feeding, general health and grooming. Dr Harry Cooper has been a practicing veterinary surgeon for over thirty years and has practiced in Sydney, Tasmania and England. Over this time he has bred a wide variety of dogs including Bulldogs, Whippets, Cavalier King Charles, Dobermans, Border Collies and Mini Foxies.

results.title: Buying and caring for your kitten
results.creator_credit: Hero Productions, Visual Entertainment Group, Harry Cooper and Kevin Manning
results.brief_description: Buying a kitten takes a lot of time and consideration. Dr Harry Cooper tries to assist this process by providing the viewer with a broad overview of some of the most popular breeds of felines and examines the merits of how to select the right breed of cat to suit you. Factors taken into consideration include health, lifestyle and budget. Once a breed has been selected, Dr Harry goes through ensuring you choose a healthy kitten, settling them in, training, socialisation, feeding, general health and grooming. Dr Harry Cooper has been a practicing veterinary surgeon for over thirty years and has practiced in Sydney, Tasmania and England. Over this time he and his family have owned and bred a wide variety of cats including Siamese, Burmese, Chinchilla, Devon Rex and Abyssinian - they have all been black.

results.title: Buying a safe car. Hazardous poles.
results.brief_description: Buying a safe car, narrated by Rob Gell looks at what happens in an automobile crash to both the occupants and the car. Discusses various safety features in design and accessories and recommends that prospective purchasers examine Crash Test Reports of the car they wish to purchase in order to ascertain its safety. “Hazardous poles” focuses on the issue of pole placement, the legal obligation of councils and authorities in ensuring safe placement and the recommended features in pole design for improved safety.

results.title: Buyer beware
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation, Rednose Revival, Vincent O'Donnell and Peter Green
results.brief_description: An animated look at the perils inherent in signing a contract which considers such familiar situations as buying a second-hand car, building a house, and purchasing household goods. Points out the need for full awareness of the conditions of sale before signing by highlighting the headaches that await the foolish consumer. Narrated by Max Gillies. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Buy, buy
results.brief_description: A wry examination of the nature of television commercials, our most potent advertising medium, as seen by the ad men and producers who make them. During the production of laxative and cosmetic commercials ad men voice strong opinions both justifying and condemning what they do. They are sometimes defensive, sometimes more cynical than any consumer.

results.title: Buy now, die later: the impact of television advertising on children's diets: a media debate
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australasia and John Moss
results.brief_description: ‘Buy now, die later’ proposes startling questions about children, advertising and diet. Questions such as why food advertising dominates children’s programs, why some foodstuffs receive more promotion than others, the issue of self-regulation, and most importantly, whether there is evidence of a negative impact on children’s health attributed to advertising. John Schwartz, a dietician from the Media Department of Swinburne University as well as Deputy Director of the Australian Food Council and a spokesperson for Youth Media Australia, analyses food ads to determine their effectiveness. An activities and discussion sheet accompanies the video.
